pageContext.claim: “The [Ohio] governor's great. But he was down 7 and he ended up winning by 7 after that final campaign stop, last day, took him up 14 points. Andy Barr in Kentucky was down by 7; he won by 6. Oh also, Cindy Hyde-Smith in the Senate, she was down by 3 or 4 points, and I went down and did two rallies. These aren't speeches, these are rallies -- big deals, with twenty or twenty-five thousand people, or more.”
pageContext.analysis: These are misleading statistics: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine (R) won by 3.7 percentage point not 7; Rep. Andy Barr (R-Ky.) won by 3.2 percent of the vote; Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith was never trailing in her 2018 Senate race, according to a CNN fact check.
